titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that defendant's Motion to Amend (Filing No. 123) is granted;that upon initial review, the court finds and concludes that summary dismissalof the defendant's Section 2255 motion (Filing No. 120) is not appropriate;that by January 6, 2006, the United States shall answer or otherwise respondto the defendant's Section 2255 motion, and shall file an accompanying brief; andthat by February 6, 2006, the defendant may file a reply briefas to Damion Wells (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 12/5/2005. (ADB)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:01-cr-00113; United States of America v. Wells;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER that defendant's Motion to Amend (Filing No. 123) is granted;that upon initial review, the court finds and concludes that summary dismissalof the defendant's Section 2255 motion (Filing No. 120) is not appropriate;that by January 6, 2006, the United States shall answer or otherwise respondto the defendant's Section 2255 motion, and shall file an accompanying brief; andthat by February 6, 2006, the defendant may file a reply briefas to Damion Wells (1). Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 12/5/2005. (ADB)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM/ORDER denying 120 Motion to Vacate (2255) as to Damion Wells (1); a separate judgment will be issued; and the Clerk is directed to mail a copy of this Memorandum and Order to the defendant at his last known address. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 3/29/2006. (copy of memo/order sent to defendant as directed) (PCV, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:01-cr-00113; United States of America v. Wells;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM/ORDER denying 120 Motion to Vacate (2255) as to Damion Wells (1); a separate judgment will be issued; and the Clerk is directed to mail a copy of this Memorandum and Order to the defendant at his last known address. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 3/29/2006. (copy of memo/order sent to defendant as directed) (PCV, )

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT regarding Memorandum and Order on Motion to Vacate (2255); Pursuant to the Memorandum and Order entered on this date, judgment is entered in favor of the government and against the defendant. The defendant's Motion under 28 U.S.C. 2255, Filing No. 120, is dismissed, with prejudice as to defendant(s) Damion Wells. Signed by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon on 3/29/2006. (PCV, ) (copy sent to defendant)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:01-cr-00113; United States of America v. Wells;

(PCV, ) (copy sent to defendant)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Damion Wells. The defendant shall show cause in writing on or before February 13, 2012, as to why this court should not dismiss his motion to reduce sentence, Filing No. 172. The Clerk of Court shall mail a copy of this order to the defendant at his last known address. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed/e-mailed to pro se party)(GJG)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Damion Wells. Defendant's motion to reduce sentence, Filing No. 172, is denied. Defendant's motion to amend, Filing No. 178 is likewise denied. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed/e-mailed to pro se party)( GJG)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant Damion Wells. The Clerk of Court shall file the Provisional Notice of Appeal in cm/ecf. The defendant shall re-file the notice of appeal with his personal signature on the filing within 30 days from the date of this order. Failure to do so shall result in the striking of the Provisional Notice of Appeal. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (GJG)(Copy mailed to pro se party)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Wells
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - This matter is before the court on defendant's Rule 59(e) motion to alter or amend a judgment. Filing No. 201. The court has reviewed the motion and finds it to be frivolous and without merit. Accordingly, the motion is denied as to defendant Damion Wells. Ordered by Judge Joseph F. Bataillon. (Copy mailed to pro se party)(GJG)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:01-cr-00113; United States of America v. Wells;
